prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: My mentor who has never known defeat in 35 years. A legendary prosecutor.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Prosecutor in Embassy staff killing case. Accused by Rell of being the Yatagarasu.
Character 2
Name: Deid Mann
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. Was gunned down in front of Embassy by Rell.
Character 3
Name: Mack Rell
Description: Embassy staff killing suspect. Arrested on suspicion for the handgun he was carrying.
Character 4
Name: Yatagarasu
Description: Real identity is unknown, but claims to be a noble thief. Infiltrated the Embassy.
Character 5
Name: ??? → Kay Faraday
Description: A girl with a balloon. During the recess, she asked me to change some coins for her.
Character 6
Name: The Judge
Description: Judge in Embassy staff killing case.
Character 7
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.
Character 8
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Lawyer of embassy staff killing defendant, Rell. I was to battle her in court.
Character 9
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. Was called in to be expert witness on the Yatagarasu case.
Character 10
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: Cohdopian Embassy staff member. He was the suspect in the KG-8 Incident.
Character 11
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor's daughter. Studying to be a prosecutor in Germany, back on break.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. My mentor said it was more chic to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: KG-8 Incident Overview
Description: Received from my mentor as reference about KG-8. [info] The headline reads: Cohdopian Embassy staff Member, Manny Coachen, Found Not Guity!
Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell. [info] Victim
Byrne Faraday (Age: 40)
Mack Rell (Age: 32)

Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard.


Remarks About the Bodies
Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away.
Evidence 6
Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.
Evidence 7
Name: Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen
Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.
Evidence 8
Name: Annual Bonus Envelope
Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.
Evidence 9
Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10
Name: Det. Badd's Testimony
Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.
Evidence 11
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints
Description: Left on the hallway bench. Black smudge emits the scent of sweet sugar. Left on the hallway bench. Det. Gumshoe apparently sat here as he ate a Swiss roll.
Evidence 12
Name: Balloon Piece
Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.
Evidence 13
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: Exchange diary between Mr. Faraday and Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: Perfume given to Badd by Yew. Same perfume as the one spilled in Lobby No. 1.
Evidence 15
Name: Mr. Faraday's Organizer
Description: Faraday wrote his strategy for winning in here.
Evidence 16
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: Photo of key the Yatagarasu sent. Unusual shape. Photo of the key the Yatagarasu sent. Turns into knife.
Evidence 17
Name: Surveillance Video
Description: Video of the Embassy staff member's murder. Gunshot is especially impactful.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mr. Faraday's death was instantaneous, while Mr. Rell survived for a short time.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: From this, it is obvious that Mr. Faraday died after he shot Mr. Rell.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: And Mr. Rell, while on the brink of death, stole Mr. Faraday's knife and stabbed him.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: They struggled, and Mr. Rell used the last of his strength to counterattack Mr. Faraday.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those are the facts of this case.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by understanding the scenario.

First, I see that the characters involved include Manfred von Karma, Byrne Faraday, Deid Mann, Mack Rell, and others. The case revolves around the Embassy staff killing, with Mack Rell as the suspect and Byrne Faraday as the prosecutor. The Yatagarasu, a mysterious thief, is also involved.

Looking at the evidences, there's a knife (Evidence 4) that was used to kill Faraday, and a handgun (Evidence 3) found in Rell's hand, which fired the fatal bullet. The crime scene notes (Evidence 5) indicate that Faraday died from a knife stab and Rell from a gunshot wound. There's also a plastic bag (Evidence 6) with Faraday's blood, a fountain pen (Evidence 7) used by Faraday, and a testimony from Det. Badd (Evidence 10) who heard the gunshot.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Franziska's testimony suggests that Faraday died after shooting Rell, and Rell, while dying, stabbed Faraday with the knife. This implies that Rell was still alive when he stabbed Faraday.

But wait, the crime scene notes (Evidence 5) state that Rell died from a bullet wound, and Faraday from a knife stab. If Rell was shot from a few yards away, as per the handgun evidence, he wouldn't have been able to stab Faraday after being shot. This seems contradictory because if Rell was fatally shot, he couldn't have counterattacked.

So, the testimony claims Rell used his last strength to stab Faraday, but the evidence shows Rell died from a gunshot wound, suggesting he couldn't have stabbed Faraday after being shot. This contradiction points to Evidence 5 and Testimony 3.
</think>

cot:
Okay, I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll list out the evidence and testimonies to understand what's going on.

**Evidence:**
- **Evidence 0:** Prosecutor's Badge - Proof of profession, kept in pocket.
- **Evidence 1:** KG-8 Incident Overview - Newspaper headline about Manny Coachen being found not guilty.
- **Evidence 2:** Det. Gumshoe's Testimony - He was on guard duty, heard a gunshot but no struggle.
- **Evidence 3:** Handgun - Found in Faraday's hand, bullet from it killed Rell from a few yards away.
- **Evidence 4:** Knife - Found in Rell's hand, used to kill Faraday, can turn into a key.
- **Evidence 5:** Crime Scene Notes - Faraday died from a knife stab, Rell from a bullet wound, no gunpowder on Rell's clothes.
- **Evidence 6:** Plastic Bag - From Lobby No. 2, has Faraday's blood.
- **Evidence 7:** Mr. Faraday's Fountain Pen - Used by left-handed Faraday.
- **Evidence 8:** Annual Bonus Envelope - Gumshoe's bonus, he had no money until he cashed it.
- **Evidence 9:** Swiss Roll - Dropped by Kay, priced at 2 for $6, Gumshoe and Kay bought it together.
- **Evidence 10:** Det. Badd's Testimony - Heard the gunshot before the trial resumed.
- **Evidence 11:** Det. Gumshoe's Fingerprints - On the bench, smudge smells like sweet sugar.
- **Evidence 12:** Balloon Piece - Found on windowsill, popped by Kay, Judge thought it was a gunshot.
- **Evidence 13:** Promise Notebook - Exchange diary between Faraday and Kay.
- **Evidence 14:** Ms. Yew's Perfume - Same as spilled in Lobby No. 1.
- **Evidence 15:** Mr. Faraday's Organizer - His strategy for winning.
- **Evidence 16:** Yatagarasu's Key - Photo of key sent by Yatagarasu, turns into knife.
- **Evidence 17:** Surveillance Video - Video of Embassy staff murder, impactful gunshot.

**Testimonies:**
- **Testimony 0:** Franziska - Faraday's death was instantaneous, Rell survived a bit.
- **Testimony 1:** Franziska - Faraday died after shooting Rell.
- **Testimony 2:** Franziska - Rell, while dying, stole Faraday's knife and stabbed him.
- **Testimony 3:** Franziska - They struggled, Rell used last strength to counterattack.
- **Testimony 4:** Franziska - These are the facts.

Now, I need to find a contradiction between any one evidence and testimony.

Looking at **Testimony 2**, Franziska says Rell, while dying, used Faraday's knife to stab him. But looking at **Evidence 5**, the Crime Scene Notes state that Rell died from a bullet wound to the chest, with no gunpowder, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away. Faraday died from a knife stab.

If Rell was shot from a few yards away, as per Evidence 5, but Testimony 2 suggests Rell stabbed Faraday after being shot, that seems contradictory. How could Rell, after being shot from a distance, manage to get close enough to stab Faraday?

This implies that either the shooting distance or the struggle happened differently than described. If Rell was shot from a few yards away, he might not have been able to get up and stab Faraday, contradicting Franziska's testimony.

So, **Evidence 5** and **Testimony 2** contradict each other because the evidence suggests Rell was shot from a distance, making it unlikely he could then stab Faraday as described.
</think>

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by looking at the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, I'll go through the evidence. Evidence 3 is a Handgun found in Faraday's hand, and the bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away. This suggests that the shooter was some distance away, not in close range. On the other hand, Evidence 5 describes that Faraday died from a knife stab to the chest, while Rell died from a bullet wound without gunpowder, indicating he was shot from a distance.

Now, looking at the testimonies, Testimony 3 from Franziska suggests that both Faraday and Rell attacked each other at the same time, indicating a close-range struggle. However, the evidence shows that Rell was shot from a few yards away, not in close proximity. This means the testimony about them attacking each other at close range doesn't align with the evidence showing Rell was shot from a distance.

Therefore, the contradiction lies in the nature of the attack—whether it was a close-range struggle or a distant shooting. The evidence points to a distant shot, while the testimony suggests a close encounter.
